X-Monitoring
Getting Started Components and Properties Tutorials

Tutorials

User Management

It describes about the user management.

Create A User

  1. Click the user registration application button on the bottom of login window.

  2. Click the administrator page link() on the left of screen.

  3. Login as the user who has the administrator authority.

  4. System - Open the user menu by clicking the user.

  5. Find ID which has applied for registration to activate and give authorization, and save after setting exclusive role.

  6. Login with the corresponding ID.

Delete A User

  1. Click the administrator page link() on the left of screen.

  2. Login as the user who has the administrator authority.

  3. System - Open the user menu by clicking the user.

  4. Check ID which has been applied for registration, click Delete on the bottom and click Save.

Find The Password

  1. Click find password button on the bottom of login page.

  2. Enter the email address which has been entered during user registration.

  3. Approve as administrator user. There are two ways to approve.
    • Click the link to proceed if receive an email.
    • Proceed through authorization menu of the administrator page.

  4. A temporary password will be sent to the email address which has been entered during user registration.

  5. Login through the temporary password.

Change The Password

  1. Click on the top left of the menu.

  2. Click change password.

  3. Enter the current and new password, and click OK.

Group And Scene Management

It describes about the group and scene.

Create A Group

  1. Click button on the bottom left.

  2. Enter Group Name, select Group Type as SCENE, and click Create button to create a group.

Change Group Name

  1. Click next to the group.

  2. Enter Group Name, click the name button to change the group name.

Authorize The Group

  1. Go to the administrator page.

  2. Login to the administrator page.

  3. System - Go to domain user menu by clicking domain user in order.

  4. Find the user who will be authorized and launch the details pop-up window.

  5. Check the group which will be authorized and click save.

  6. Go back to the board to refresh, and get group information newly.

Create A Scene

  1. Go to the group which will create the Scene.

  2. Click button on the bottom right.

  3. Enter the name of Scene and click Save.

Edit The Scene

  1. Go to the group in which has the Scene to be edited.

  2. Click on the bottom of Scene to go to the information page.

  3. Click the edit button() on the top right of information page to go to the modeling page.

Copy The Scene

  1. Go to the group in which has the Scene to be copied.

  2. Click on the bottom of Scene to go to the information page.

  3. Click Copy button on the bottom of information page.

  4. Enter the name of Scene which will be created newly and click Save.

Delete The Scene

  1. Go to the group in which has the scene to be deleted.

  2. Click on the bottom of Scene to go to the information page.

  3. Click Delete button on the bottom of information page.

  4. Click OK button to delete.

Change Scene Group

  1. Go to the group in which has the corresponding Scene.

  2. Drag the Scene which will change the group and drop in the group which will be changed among the left group list.

  3. Click the corresponding group to check if the Scene has been moved.

Update Scene Name

  1. Go to the group in which has the corresponding Scene.

  2. Click on the bottom of Scene to go to the information page.

  3. Click the change name button on the bottom of information page.

  4. After enter the name which will be changed, click OK button.

Get The Scene

It describes about the function to copy the scene modeling information of another server.

  1. Click the administrator page link() on the left of screen.

  2. Open a new tab of the same browser to access X-Monitoring in which has the scene to be copied, and login.

  3. Check the Scene Name of Scene which will be copied.

  4. Click the label - Scene in order on the left menu of administrator page to go to Scene menu.

  5. Click Get button on the bottom of Scene menu.

  6. Enter the URL of Scene which will be copied to the pop-up, select the Group in which will save the Scene and click OK.

  7. If appear the success message on the bottom left, go back to the board and refresh to check.

Modeling

It describes about the function of modeler.

Modeler Layout

It describes about the layout of modeler.

  1. Control Toolbar: The toolbar in which has concentrated the function of controlling the component like return, copy, sort, reverse, etc.

  2. Component toolbar: The toolbar in which has concentrated the component of being used in modeler.

  3. Property window: The window in which has concentrated the property of component.

Control Toolbar

The toolbar which has listed the necessary functions for simplifying the information of SCENE and modeling.
(If OS is Mac, enter ⌘ in place of Ctrl key.)

  1. Scene number :
    Display the number of Scene which is currently being worked on.

  2. Revert(Ctrl + Z) :
    The function which can revert the contents finally edited by the user.

  3. Rerun(Ctrl + Shift + Z) :
    Run the contents of work gain which has been canceled by reverting.

  4. Cut(Ctrl + X) :
    Copy the selected component to the clipboard and delete the current component.

  5. Copy(Ctrl + C) :
    Copy the selected component to the clipboard.

  6. Paste(Ctrl + V) :
    Paste the copied component to the clipboard.

  7. Delete(Delete or Backspace) :
    Delete the selected component.

  8. Copy style :
    Only copy the applied style of the selected component to the clipboard. (Not implemented yet)

  9. Align left(Alt + Shift + L) :
    Align components left based on the left most component of the selected components.

  10. Align center(Alt + Shift + C) :
    Align X-coordinate of components center based on the center coordinate of the selected components.

  11. Align right(Alt + Shift + R) :
    Align components right based on the right most component of the selected components.

  12. Align top(Alt + Shift + T) :
    Align components top based on the top most component of the selected components.

  13. Align center(Alt + Shift + M) :
    Align Y-coordinate of components center based on the center coordinate of the selected components.

  14. Align bottom(Alt + Shift + B) :
    Align components bottom based on the bottom most component of the selected components.

  15. Distribute width evenly(Alt + Shift + H) :
    Distribute the width between each component evenly based on the component on both ends of horizontal direction of the selected components.

  16. Distribute height evenly(Alt + Shift + V) :
    Distribute the height between each component evenly based on the component on both ends of vertical direction of the selected components.

  17. To the very front(Ctrl + Shift + F) :
    Send the order of selected component to the very front.

  18. To the very end(Ctrl + Shift + B) :
    Send the order of selected component to the very end.

  19. Move one block forward(Ctrl + F) :
    Move the order of selected component one block forward.

  20. Move one block back(Ctrl + B) :
    Move the order of selected component one block back.

  21. Mirror horizontally(Alt + Shift + X) :
    Mirror the selected component horizontally.

  22. Mirror vertically(Alt + Shift + Y) :
    Mirror the selected component vertically.

  23. Rotate clockwise(Alt + Shift + E) :
    Rotate the selected component 90 degrees clockwise.

  24. Rotate counterclockwise(Alt + Shift + W) :
    Rotate the selected component 90 degrees counterclockwise.

  25. Group(Ctrl + G) :
    Group the selected components.

  26. Ungroup(Ctrl + Shift + G) :
    Ungroup the selected group.

  27. Increase text size(Shift + WheelUp) :
    Increase the text size of the selected component.

  28. Decrease text size(Shift + WheelDown) :
    Decrease the text size of the selected component.

  29. Adjust canvas size(Ctrl + D) :
    Resize the size of canvas just to the screen.

  30. Full screen :
    Hide all the toolbar and property windows and convert the modeling screen to the full screen.

  31. Hide property window(Ctrl + H) :
    Hide or show the property window.

Component Toolbar

The toolbar in which has concentrated the component being used in the modeler. If click the required component in the component toolbar, the corresponding component will be added to the modeler.

  • : Change the selection mode and shift mode. It will operate as shift mode during pressing Space.

  • : Contain line component.

  • : Contain shape component.

  • : Contain text component.

  • : Contain image component.

  • : Contain gauge component.

  • : Contain chart component.

  • : Contain table component.

Property Window

It describes about the functions of property window.

  1. : The property related to the shape of component. You can assign ID, class or specify the width, height, etc.

  2. : You can specify the property, color, font related to the style of component.

  3. : The property related to the effect of component. You can specify the shadow, animation, click event.

  4. : The specific property of component.

  5. : The property related to the data of Scene.

Save The Modeler

There are two ways to save after the modeling.

  • The way to use the button
    1. Click on the right bottom of modeler.
    2. Click to save.
  • The way to use shortcut key
    1. Click the modeling area.
    2. Enter the save shortcut.
    • Save shortcut keys of each OS
      • Windows: Ctrl + S
      • MacOS: ⌘ + S

Data Binding

Describe the function of binding the data to a scene.

Data

The necessary function to substitute the data in component. Each component has one data. If want to receive the data from server, component ID should be aligned with the data of server.

Data Component Mapping

Describe how data and components are mapped..

  1. Click the Data tab, which is the 5th tab of the Property window..
  2. Assign ID to the Component. Data coming from the server maps its key (data name) to the ID of the same component. (That is, component ID and data key should be the same.)
  3. Enter ID of the target. The target can be itself and it can share the same data with other components.
  4. Enter the property to be changed. Property determines which properties of the component should be changed when the data is received.
  5. Enter the default value in the table. The default value is the initial value of the data before data of the actual data is received. If the data is not in array format, the default value will recognize only the data of the first line of Field1, as shown in the image below.
  6. The value of the data is entered as ‘data’ property of the component. To use this value in other properties of the component, you can enter #{data} in Property input window.
    ( Enter #{property_name} to replace the value of the corresponding property. )

Data Spread

Describe how the data assigned to the component is injected into other components.

  1. Assign ID to target component.
  2. Click the Data tab in the Properties window.
  3. Enter the default value ​​in the table. (May be omitted.)
  4. Enter accessor as required.
  5. Specify Target component.
  6. Specify Property.
  7. Specify Rule.

Data Mapping Accessor

Accessors are required to access internal properties if the data is an Object or an Array. If nothing is entered, the value of the first line of Field1 is used by default.

  • access to Array: [0] 
    // e.g. 
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, ...] // Assign accessor to [1]

2 // Access result
  • access to Object: [value] or .value 
    // e.g.
{
  "key1": "value1",
  "key2": "value2",
  "key3": "value3",
  "key4": "value4",
  ...
} // Assign accessor to [key2]

"value2" // Access result

Data Mapping Target

Set the target to propagate the data value.
There are three methods below.

  1. Set up relative targets
    • (self): Target itself.
    • (key): Target the components that match the key of data.
      Used if the type of data is an Object. 
       // e.g. 
 {
     "id1": 1,
     "id2": 2,
     "id3": 3
 } // Specify the target as (key)
        
 1 // Data of the component whose ID is id1
 2 // Data of the component whose ID is id2
 3 // Data of the component whose ID is id3
  2. Set up via ID
    • #id: Target the matching component by entering component ID.
    • .class: Target the matching components by entering component class.
  3. Set up the target via the key value of the data
    • [dataKey]: Target the component whose ID matches the value of dataKey corresponding to the input value.
      Used if the type of data is Object-Array. 
       // e.g. 
 [{
     "id": "component-1",
     "value": "1"
 }, {
     "id": "component-2",
     "value": "2"
 }, {
     "id": "component-3",
     "value": "3"
 }] // Specify the target as [id]

 {
     "id": "component-1",
     "value": "1"
 } // Data of the component whose ID is component-1
 {
     "id": "component-2",
     "value": "2"
 } // Data of the component whose ID is component-2
 {
     "id": "component-3",
     "value": "3"
 } // Data of the component whose ID is component-3

Data Mapping Property

Set in which target property it will assign the data value.

Data Mapping Rule

Specify a rule for the value of the data.

  1. Value: Assign the value of the data as it is. (The most basic options)
  2. MAP: Convert to a specific value according to the value of the data. (In the example below, if the data value is 0, FillStyle is changed to green, 1 is yellow, and 2 is red.)
  3. Range: Set the value to be converted according to the range of the data value. (In the example below, FillStyle is changed to green when data value is less than 0 ~ 10, yellow when it is less than 10 ~ 20, and red when it is less than 20 ~ 30.)
  4. Eval: The function to manipulate data values ​​and component properties with JavaScript coding.
    argument is as follows.
    • value: The data accessed through accessors.
    • this: The component received the data.
       // e.g. Change the value of the component by 'data value * 100'
 /* 
 receiveData = {
     "goodRate": 0.973,
     "badRate": 0.027,
     "goodCount": 19000,
     ...
 }

 accessor = goodRate

 value = 0.973
  */
 return value * 100 // value of the component: 97.3

Board Data Binder

Describe the publisher, which is a function that pushes the data to a Scene.

  1. Click on the admin page link () on the left side of the screen.

  2. From the menu on the left side of the admin page, click Monitoring Board Management - Board Data Binder in order to move to the Scene menu.

  3. Click Add button at the bottom of the board data binder menu.

  4. Enter the board data binder name and board, and click Save button.
    • The board is SCENE-NAME(e.g. : SCENE-XX).

  5. Click of the added board data binder to open the Detailed Page popup.

  6. On the detailed page, enter values ​​in Return type and fields.

  7. Enter SQL in the bottom Service Logic field and save.

  8. Click the test button () to see if the data is displayed normally.

Board Data Binder Return Type

  • Array Type
    Return the execution result of SQL as a list.

    Input field :

    • data key : The name to hold the SQL execution result.

    For example, when SQL, Record Set and data key are as below

    SELECT ID, AGE, DEPARTMENT, WORK_YEAR FROM EMPLOYEE
    ID AGE DEPARTMENT WORK_YEAR
    e00001 30 SALES 1
    e00002 37 DEVELOPMENT 5
    e00003 45 HR 12

    data key: data

    The result is as follows.

    {
  "data": [{
    "ID": "e00001",
    "AGE": 30,
    "DEPARTMENT": "SALES",
    "WORK_YEAR": 1
  }, {
    "ID": "e00002",
    "AGE": 37,
    "DEPARTMENT": "DEVELOPMENT",
    "WORK_YEAR": 5
  }, {
    "ID": "e00003",
    "AGE": 45,
    "DEPARTMENT": "HR",
    "WORK_YEAR": 12
  }]
}

  • Key-Value Type Return the execution result of SQL as JSON Object of key-value type.

    Input field :

    • key field : The field name to hold the SQL execution result. (The record value of the field becomes the key.)
    • value field : The field name to be used as the value among the SQL execution result. (The record value of the field becomes the value.)

    For example, when SQL, Record Set, key field and value field are as below

    SELECT ID, AGE, DEPARTMENT, WORK_YEAR FROM EMPLOYEE
    ID AGE DEPARTMENT WORK_YEAR
    e00001 30 SALES 1
    e00002 37 DEVELOPMENT 5
    e00003 45 HR 12

    key field: ID, value field: DEPARTMENT

    The result is as follows.

    {
  "e00001": "SALES",
  "e00002": "DEVELOPMENT",
  "e00003": "HR"
}

  • Key-Object Type
    Return the execution result of SQL as JSON Object of Key-Object type.

    Input field :

    • key field : The field name to hold the SQL execution result. (The record value of the field becomes the key.)

    For example, when SQL, Record Set, key field are as below

    SELECT ID, AGE, DEPARTMENT, WORK_YEAR FROM EMPLOYEE
    ID AGE DEPARTMENT WORK_YEAR
    e00001 30 SALES 1
    e00002 37 DEVELOPMENT 5
    e00003 45 HR 12

    key field: ID

    The result is as follows.

    {
  "e00001": {
    "AGE": 30,
    "DEPARTMENT": "SALES",
    "WORK_YEAR": 1
  },
  "e00002": {
    "AGE": 37,
    "DEPARTMENT": "DEVELOPMENT",
    "WORK_YEAR": 5
  },
  "e00003": {
    "AGE": 45,
    "DEPARTMENT": "HR",
    "WORK_YEAR": 12
  }
}

  • Single Row Type
    Return the execution result of SQL as JSON Object. The result must have only one row.

    Input field :

    • Data Key(optional) : The name to hold the SQL execution result.

    For example, when SQL and Record Set are as below

    SELECT ID, AGE, DEPARTMENT, WORK_YEAR FROM EMPLOYEE LIMIT 1
    ID AGE DEPARTMENT WORK_YEAR
    e00001 30 SALES 1

    The result of the data key is as follows.

    1. If the data key is data 
      {
  "data": {
    "ID": "e00001",
    "AGE": 30,
    "DEPARTMENT": "SALES",
    "WORK_YEAR": 1
  }
}
    2. If the data key is blank 
      {
  "ID": "e00001",
  "AGE": 30,
  "DEPARTMENT": "SALES",
  "WORK_YEAR": 1
}

Refer The Scene

It describes about the function to refer the screen of another Scene in Scene.

Refer To Scene

If use Reference-Scene, you can refer another Scene within Scene.

  1. Global Reference:
    Refer another Scene and display on the screen.

  2. Local Reference:
    Refer a specific component within Scene and display on the screen.

Link The Scene

It describes about Goto function which can link another Scene within Scene.

  1. Click the effect property window after click the component.

  2. Set the data information of tab event as Goto.

  3. Set the Scene-name of Scene which will be linked as a value.

Play The Scene

It describes about the function to display several Scenes sequentially or display them on one screen.

Create Play Group

It describes about how to create a play group in which will concentrate the scene through play function.

  1. Click button on the bottom left.

  2. Enter Group Name, select Group Type as PLAY, and click Create button to create the group.

Authorize Play Group

It describes about how to authorize the play group for user.

  1. Go to the administrator page.

  2. Login to administrator page.

  3. System - Go to the domain user menu by clicking the domain user in order.

  4. Find the user who will be authorized to launch the detail screen pop-up.

  5. Check the play group which will be authorized and click Save.

  6. Go back to the board and refresh to receive the play group information newly.

Add Scene To Play Group

  1. Go to the group of containing the scene which will be added to the play group.

  2. Drag the scene and drop in the play group.

Play

  1. Go to the play group.

  2. Click on the bottom right.

  3. After select the play mode and cycle, click OK.

The Types Of Play

  1. Carousel: Show the scenes in the play group one by one sequentially.

  2. Filp-card: Show 2 scenes in the play group sequentially.

  3. Flip-card2: It is the same as Flip-card, and the display effect is different.

  4. Grid: Show the scene of play group by arranging in the form of Grid.
